title: How to Make Your Own Pattern for Sewing a New Piece of Clothing

steps.headline: Gather supplies.
steps.description: An old bed sheet works well for this project.

steps.headline: Take measurements.
steps.description: Measure the general length and width for each pattern piece.

steps.headline: Cut the sheet.
steps.description: Cut squares and rectangles for each pattern piece.

steps.headline: Fit your model.
steps.description: Drape each pattern piece over your model.

steps.headline: Refine your pattern.
steps.description: Cut and shape your pattern pieces. Pin or baste each pattern piece together along the seam-line. Leave a half-inch seam allowance on all sides of each pattern piece.

steps.headline: Refine your design.
steps.description: Use tailor's chalk to mark certain areas. Create pleats, tucks or darts with common pins. Create gathers and hemlines with a basting stitch.

steps.headline: Remove the pattern from the model.
steps.description: Use tailor's chalk to mark all pinned or basted areas, if needed.

steps.headline: Cut your fabric.
steps.description: Using your new pattern, cut fabric for your actual garment.

steps.headline: Baste your garment together.
steps.description: Baste all seams by hand or use the loosest stitch on  your sewing machine.

steps.headline: Refit your model.
steps.description: Place the basted garment on your model and make final adjustments to your design. Remove the basting.

steps.headline: Stitch your garment together.
steps.description: Use the sewing machine for seams. Hand-stitch hemlines for a nice finished look.
